Content.title: Counterspell Giza
Content.Desc_1: Counterspell Giza was a 12-hour game jam hosted at STEM High School for Boys – 6th of October, where 100+ high school students came together to build games from scratch. As part of Hack Club’s global
Content.Desc_2: , it ranked #1 out of 49+ cities, making it the top event worldwide.
Content.Desc_3: Students formed teams of 3–4 and spent the day learning, coding, and creating playable games — many for the first time. Whether beginners or experienced builders, everyone left with a project and new skills.
Content.Desc_4: Led by 11 student organizers, Counterspell Giza became the largest game jam ever held in Egypt, setting a new standard for youth-led tech events in the region.

Participant.description: Custom event T-shirt for every participant
Participant.title: Custom T-shirt

Participant.description: Laptop stickers, pins, and other cool merch
Participant.title: Stickers & Swag

Highlights.caption: Kicking off the day with energy and excitement — the opening ceremony sets the tone.
Matching shirts, shared goals — the Counterspell Giza experience begins.
Zaki and Zoro dropping the coolest pose of the day.
A quick snippet from the Pygame workshop with Kareem in action.
Lillith pulled up and instantly stole the show.
Working on their game — and their plates.
Laughter, code, and shawerma — the essentials of a great hackathon.
Locked in — the focus that led them to 1st place.
The force behind Counterspell Giza — thank you, team!
